channel.title: Math on Homepage of Vašek

item.title: Partial preorders
item.author: blazeva1 -a- fit.cvut.cz <Václav Blažej> (Václav Blažej)
item.description:
Let us have a preorder ↗ that is unknown to us. Our ultimate goal is to discover it entirely but before that we have only partial information. For every pair A and B we can have $A \le B$, $A 
ot\le B$, or unknown. When we know relations in both directions between two elements we may get $A 
ot\le B \land B 
ot\le A$ implies that $A$ and $B$ are incomparable, $A \le B \land B 
ot\le A$ implies $A < B$ (and vice-versa), or $A \le B \land B \le A$ implies $A = B$.
